author: NBCNews.com
title: Cal Perry on the scene in South Dakota prior to the arrival of President Trump
description: MSNBC Correspondent Cal Perry is on the ground in South Dakota amidst protests for President Trump's visit to mark the Fourth of July
source.name: MSNBC

title: Houston mayor: ‘We have a very narrow window’ to control COVID-19
description: As coronavirus cases surge in Texas, Houston Mayor Sylvester Turner shares what his city is doing to fight COVID-19.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: 'Strange fruit': How Black artists defied U.S. racism, got it right and paid the price
description: As protests force a reckoning on policing, MSNBC’s Ari Melber reports on how Black activists and artists have confronted government racism, both in their work and their own lives. Tracing political and musical history ranging from Sam Cooke and Billie Holiday…
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Epidemiologist Marc Lipsitch on the Risks Americans Face with Reopening
description: As coronavirus cases continue to grow across the country, Harvard epidemiologist Marc Lipsitch discusses the risks of reopening and trajectory of the spread.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Former GOPer laments masks becoming political battleground
description: Donald Trump ‘allowed masks to become political’ renounced GOPer and former Republican congressman David Jolly tells Tiffany Cross in for Joy Reid.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: 'Trump is a threat to our nation’: Hundreds of ex-staffers under George W. Bush endorse Biden
description: Kristopher Purcell, a member of 43 Alumni for Biden, explains why hundreds of Republican ex-staffers under George W. Bush are coming together to endorse Joe Biden and says, “Donald Trump is a threat to our nation.”
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Intel community's new memo post-Russian bounties story questioned
description: Donald Trump was briefed on the intelligence that Russia paid Taliban-linked actors to kill Americans in Afghanistan at least twice reporter on the story Rukmini Callimachi believes. Callimachi, correspondent for The New York Times, joins Tiffany Cross in for…
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: 'He's not in touch with reality': Artist on Trump saying 'Black Lives Matter' is a 'symbol of hate'
description: NBC News' Gary Grumbach reports from Harlem, where new Black Lives Matter murals are being paint in New York City's streets - and across all five of the city's boroughs. President Trump previously decried Mayor Bill de Blasio's plans to paint "Black Lives Mat…
source.name: MSNBC

title: Eddie Glaude: ‘Allyship collapses when we view racial justice as a philanthropic exercise’
description: Eddie Glaude, chairman of the Center for African American Studies at Princeton University and author of ‘Begin Again: James Baldwin’s America and Its Urgent Lessons for Our Own,’ says equality is about collaboration, not charity.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Andre Perry: ‘Black communities have been socially distanced for generations’
description: Andre Perry, a Brookings Institute fellow and author of ‘Know Your Price: Valuing Black Lives and Property in America’s Black Cities,’ explains how segregation robbed Black households of “the wealth needed to withstand crises like these.”
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Nikole Hannah-Jones: ‘Independence Day has always been very complex for Black Americans’
description: Nikole Hannah-Jones, Pulitzer Prize-winning creator of the New York Times Magazine’s 1619 Project, and Pulitzer Prize-winning historian Jon Meacham say it’s time for America to live up to the “mission statement” of July 4th.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: D.L. Hughley: Even when you’re ‘asymptomatic of white supremacy,’ it happens in your wake
description: Comedian, radio show host and author of ‘Surrender, White People!’ D.L. Hughley argues that white supremacy is as destructive to American society as COVID-19 and other diseases.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Velshi: July 4th celebrates American ideals we haven’t achieved
description: MSNBC’s Ali Velshi says Frederick Douglass’ 1852 speech about the “justice, liberty, prosperity and independence” denied to slaves still resonates for Black Americans today.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Veteran: Russia bounty story is such a betrayal on many levels
description: Donald Trump’s reaction to reports that Russia placed bounties on American soldiers fighting in Afghanistan has been slammed by many critics. Dr. Dan Barkhuff of Veterans For Responsible Leadership joins Tiffany Cross in for Joy Reid to discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: 'There's people everywhere': Thousands flock to North Carolina beaches for Fourth of July weekend
description: NBC News' Amanda Golden reports from Corolla, North Carolina as locals and people from New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Maryland, and Washington D.C., flock to the Tar Heel state's beaches for Independence Day weekend.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Trump’s Mount Rushmore trip decried by Native American activists
description: Donald Trump’s Mount Rushmore speech and July 4th event has been decried by Native American activists, and was protested by members of the Native American community, some of whom were arrested. Sarah Manning of the NDN Collective joins Tiffany Cross in for Jo…
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: On Fourth of July weekend, Biden projects optimism against Trump's 'dystopia of fascism'
description: Joe Biden sends a Fourth of July message in response to President Trump’s Mount Rushmore speech. He warns President Trump could dismantle democracy if he is re-elected, MSNBC’s Betsy Woodruff Swan reports.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: 'Shattered the previous record': Florida records more than 11,000 coronavirus cases in one day
description: Florida sets state record in number of new coronavirus cases in a single day with 11,458. There have been 190,052 total cases of COVID-19 and 3,702 deaths in Florida since the outbreak began.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Barber slams ‘scarcity of will’ for economic issues plaguing U.S.

source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Latinx activist asks all impacted by police brutality to unite
description: Police shooting deaths and other deaths enacted by officers impacting the black community have been the focus of recent protests, yet other communities, such as the Latinx community, also suffer disproportionately from such violence taking innocent lives. The…
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Police clashes with Native Americans often ‘invisible’ activist laments
description: Police violence used against Native Americans is often ‘invisible’ activist Gyasi Ross asserts, as he recounts the case of Stonechild Chiefstick, a father of five who was killed by a Poulsbo, WA police officer at a 2019 fireworks display in a shooting that wa…

author: NBCNews.com
title: Former diplomat: U.S. looks ‘stupid’ on Russian bounties response
description: Donald Trump not adequately addressing reports that Russia placed bounties on U.S. soldiers in Afghanistan is analyzed by Nayyera Haq, former White House and State Department senior director.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: COVID-19 spikes linked to GOP leadership by Arizona congressman
description: Arizona and other states with Republican leadership are seeing surges in COVID-19 cases, leading many to slam some GOP leaders as failing to properly combat the coronavirus pandemic. Tiffany Cross in for Joy Reid and her panel discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Is the NFL doing enough in the wake of George Floyd protests?

source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Descendent of Robert E. Lee says statues should be removed
description: Rev. Robert Lee IV is a direct descendent of Confederate General Robert E. Lee and is calling for the removal of statues of his ancestors.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Memo to Trump: 'You've referred to the movement for Black lives as insurrectionist'
description: Rev. Al Sharpton addresses the president's glaring dismissal of the Black Lives Matter movement and its commitment to communities of color.
